addressbook module¶

Address Book Module.

For simple Address Book applet - Project 1 - CIS 422, W‘14, University of Oregon.

author:Abdulrahman Alkhelaifi <abdul@cs.uoregon.edu>
class addressbook.AddressBook(contacts=[])¶

Bases: object

A simple personal address book. Holds a list of Contact objects and provides multiple functionalities to handle them.

add(entry)¶

Add an entry to the address book given a single Contact or a list of Contacts. Store the abbreviation of the states.

delete(index)¶

Remove an entry from the address book given its index. The index is returned by the search method.

Raises IndexError if index is not in the list.
export_contacts(file_name)¶

Export the contacts list to a tsv file. The format of the file is as follows:

Last<tab>Delivery<tab>Second<tab>Recipient<tab>Phone<NL>
followed by a list of contacts with the same format.

Raises IOError if file exist and has no write permission.

import_contacts(file_name)¶

Import a contacts list from a tsv file. The format of the file is as follows:

Last<tab>Delivery<tab>Second<tab>Recipient<tab>Phone<NL>
followed by a list of contacts with the same format.

Raises IOError if file is not found or has no read permission.

Raises Error if file is not a standard tsv file.
merge_addressbook(address_book=None)¶

Merge Contacts that have the same first and last name in the same address book or combine two address books and merge them.

print_all_mailing()¶

Return a string representation of the whole address book in the standard mailing label format.

search(attribute, value, search_list=None)¶

Search the address book for all entries with a given attribute and its value. This method can be called multiple times passing the result from each call as the third argument to narrow the search.

sort(attributes=['lname'], desc=False)¶

Sort the address book by the given list of attributes. The first attribute is used and ties are broken using the next attributes in the list.

Raises AttributeError if one of the attributes does not exist.
class addressbook.Contact¶

Bases: object

A class representing a single entry in the address book.

default_attrs = ['fname', 'lname', 'address', 'address2', 'city', 'state', 'zipcode', 'phone', 'email']¶
get_filtered_info()¶

Return a dictionary of filtered information for the Contact object. Useful when Contact has empty fields.

name: first last
delivery: address second
last: city state zipcode
phone: phone
email: email
address: address
second: second
merge_contact(other)¶

Merge Contacts that have the same first and last name.

print_mailing()¶

Return a string representation in the standard mailing label format.

NAME (FIRST LAST) (e.g., ABC MOVERS)
DELIVERY (ADDRESS SECOND) (e.g., 1500 E MAIN AVE STE 201)
LAST (CITY STATE ZIP) (e.g., SPRINGFIELD VA 22162-1010)
